title: Drawing, "Balustrade at top of a flight of stairs"
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, graphite
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d)
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Horizontal rectangle. Five stairs lead to a landing bordered in front, at right, by a balustrade. The mason's work of the first section, the first embedded baluster and the first free one, and the second sections are executed. Partly colored background.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Balustrade at top of a flight of stairs".
Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, graphite. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-1800.
